title: Barcelona-Real Madrid: Why this is the most important Cl√°sico in years
content: El Cl√°sico is always huge, but with Barcelona and Real Madrid meeting so late in the season with a title still on the line, this is one for the ages.

title: Knights score with 0.4 left to stun Oilers in Game 3
content: Reilly Smith scored with 0.4 left on a shot that deflected in off Leon Draisaitl's stick to give the Golden Knights a stunning 4-3 victory in Game 3.

title: Miami LB Hayes injured during fatal car crash
content: Miami linebacker Adarius Hayes was injured in a car crash that killed two children in his hometown of Largo, Florida, a police department spokesperson told ESPN.

title: Do-it-all Randle's triple-double fuels Wolves' win
content: Julius Randle put all of his skills on display Saturday night, posting 24 points, 12 assists and 10 rebounds and making key defensive stops down the stretch to the propel the Wolves in Game 3.

title: McCullers: Family got death threats during loss
content: A team spokesperson said the Astros notified both the Houston Police Department and Major League Baseball security about the threats made at Lance McCullers Jr. and his family.

title: Rockies GM backs Black before 21-0 loss to Pads
content: Rockies GM Bill Schmidt backed manager Bud Black before the Rockies' 21-0 loss Saturday night dropped Colorado to 6-33 on the season.

title: Saints kick off QB competition as Carr retires
content: Saints starting quarterback Derek Carr has decided to retire because of a labral tear and degenerative rotator cuff injury in his right shoulder, leading the team to begin its QB competition in earnest.

title: Della Maddalena wins Muhammad's belt in slugfest
content: Jack Della Maddalena became the new welterweight champion after besting Belal Muhammad in a thrilling five-round slugfest at UFC 315.

title: Aldo retires from UFC: 'Can't do this anymore'
content: Jose Aldo, widely considered one of the greatest featherweights in UFC history, announced he is retiring after dropping a unanimous decision to Aiemann Zahabi at UFC 315.

title: üèÄ Prospects to watch at the NBA draft combine
content: With 120 players expected at the NBA draft combine in Chicago, here's everything to watch out for and know.

title: 2025 NBA MVP: Who will win between Jokic and SGA?
content: Who will win the MVP award: Nuggets' Nikola Jokic, Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo or Thunder's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander?

title: Can the Saints' offense find success with Tyler Shough starting as a rookie?
content: With a new coach and suddenly a new QB, the Saints' offense is hard to predict. Let's explore how this unit could look with Shough under center.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Pivotal Game 3 in Jets-Stars, Game 4 for Leafs-Panthers
content: Will Dallas or Winnipeg pull ahead? And can Florida pull even? Plus, Saturday's highlights and Three Stars.

title: Why four of MLB's top closers are struggling -- and if they can bounce back
content: Emmanuel Clase is just one of baseball's elite 2024 relievers who has had issues this season. But all hope might not be lost ... yet.

title: Dias fumes at Southampton: They didn't even try
content: Manchester City defender R√∫ben Dias sounded off over Southampton's style of play after the two sides drew 0-0 in the Premier League on Saturday, accusing them of "not even trying to play."

title: Atleti's S√∏rloth nets earliest-ever LaLiga hat trick
content: Atl√©tico Madrid striker Alexander S√∏rloth scored the earliest hat trick in LaLiga history as part of four goals in the first half hour to fuel a 4-0 rout of Real Sociedad on Saturday.

title: Messi scores but Miami suffers rout by Minnesota
content: Lionel Messi's fifth MLS goal of the season wasn't enough to prevent his Inter Miami side from being routed 4-1 by Minnesota United in St. Paul on Saturday.

title: Angry Sevilla fans break into training ground
content: A large group of Sevilla fans forced their way onto the premises of the club's training ground on Saturday after their anger at the team's bad season boiled over following another loss.

title: Ancelotti praises Alonso: He has 'all doors open'
content: Carlo Ancelotti said Xabi Alonso has "all doors open" as he leaves Bayer Leverkusen, praising the "fantastic job" the man expected to replace him at Real Madrid has done with the Bundesliga side.

title: Hamburg clinch Bundesliga return after 7 years
content: After seven years of suffering, Hamburger SV finally clinched their return to the Bundesliga by routing Ulm 6-1 in Germany's second division on Saturday.

title: Angel City's King 'stable' after on-field collapse
content: Angel City defender Savy King was "responsive and undergoing further evaluation" after being stretchered off the field following a "medical event" during the team's match against the Utah Royals on Friday night.

title: Inside the goals of WNBA's next CBA -- travel, roster size, and yes, pay
content: Increased salaries, revenue sharing and salary cap are among the issues being negotiated for WNBA's new CBA.

title: Welcome aboard: These are college football's top newcomers
content: From top recruits to big-time transfers, these players look to impact the College Football Playoff hopefuls.

title: How Chelsea women made history with unbeaten WSL season
content: Chelsea wrapped up the Women's Super League title a few weeks ago, but they finished the season with an unbeaten record. Here's how they did it.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye shock move for Raya
content: Arsenal may face a battle to keep David Raya at the club with Real Madrid reportedly interested. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Operation Sindoor: What India Achieved - NDTV Explains
content: India launched a massive strike deep inside Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir (PoJK) to avenge the killing of Indian civilians by Pakistan-linked terrorists. The operation was an absolute success, the government has said.

title: Turning Point Was India's Air Strikes: Army Explains Pak's Change In Stance
content: The ceasefire proposal from Pakistan - after four days of missile attack and cross-border firing - was brought about by the air strikes conducted by India, government source said today.

title: "Pakistan Army Lost At Least 35-40 Personnel": Special Briefing On Operation Sindoor
content: The Pakistan Army lost nearly 35 to 40 personnel between May 7-10, when India launched retaliatory counterstrikes in response to the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, said (DGMO) Lt Gen Rajiv Ghai.

title: Putin Proposes Direct Peace Talks With Ukraine After Three Years Of War
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed direct talks with Ukraine aimed at ending the war, an initiative welcomed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy who said Kyiv was willing to talk but Moscow must agree to a ceasefire.

title: "More Than 100 Terrorists Killed In 9 Terror Hubs," Says Army On Op Sindoor
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) identified nine targets in Pakistan after a careful deliberation under Operation Sindoor, and launched the strikes, killing over 100 terrorists on May 7, senior military officers told reporters today.

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE¬†Updates: Army Shares Photos Of Damage On Pak Terror Camps During Op Sindoor
content: India Pakistan Tension LIVE Updates: Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi has given the go-ahead to all Army Commanders in the western borders to launch counteraction if the understanding reached between India and Pakistan 's on Saturday is violated.

title: Experts Share Visuals Of Pak Air Bases Hit By Indian Cruise Missiles
content: Open source intelligence (OSINT) experts and analysts have posted maps and visuals of what they claimed were damages to Pakistan's military infrastructure in cruise missile strikes by India.

title: Free Flights, Cash Bonus: Inside Trump's New Plan For Migrants Who Self-Deport From US
content: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order establishing a new self-deportation program offering free flights and cash bonuses to undocumented migrants to help them leave America voluntarily.

title: "Unless Pak Understands...": Salman Khurshid's "Terror" Caveat On Talks
content: Pakistan has to understand that terrorism is unacceptable else no amount of dialogues will reach the desired conclusion, former External Affairs Salman Khurshid said today

title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy Calls On Russia To Confirm Ceasefire Before Talks
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on Russia on Sunday to confirm an unconditional ceasefire beginning on May 12, saying Ukraine would then be ready to meet for direct talks with Russia.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How IAF Taught Pakistan That The Mythical 'Godzilla' Isn't Extinct After All
content: For military planners, India's performance provides a case study in how middle powers can effectively employ air assets to achieve limited strategic objectives while managing escalation with nuclear-armed adversaries.

title: Army Chief Grants "Full Authority" To Commanders For Counteraction If Ceasefire Violated
content: Indian Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi has given the green light to all Army Commanders in the western borders to launch counteraction if the understanding reached between India and Pakistan's DGMOs on Saturday is violated.

title: Pope Leo's 'No More War' Message Amid India-Pakistan Tensions
content: Pope Leo XIV appealed to the world's major powers for "no more war" in his first Sunday message to crowds in St. Peter's Square since his election as pontiff.

title: Kremlin Focuses On 2022 Draft Deal For Proposed Russia-Ukraine Peace Talks
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's proposed peace talks with Ukraine will take into account an abandoned 2022 draft deal between the two countries and the reality of Russia's control over almost a fifth of Ukraine, the Kremlin said on Sunday.

title: How UK Is Planning To Change Visa Rules Amid Immigration Crackdown
content: The UK government is planning to tighten visa requirements for migrant workers to curb the number of people coming to Britain through legal routes.

title: "Shouldn't Be Blamed": Asaduddin Owaisi After Foreign Secretary Trolled
content: AIMIM chief and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi has slammed trolls targeting Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri following the government's announcement of the ceasefire with Pakistan

title: Pak Envoy Was Asked About Trump's Role In Ceasefire With India. His Reply
content: Pakistan's High Commissioner to the United Kingdom, Mohammad Faisal, during an interview with the UK's Sky News, was asked whether he could clarify the role of President Trump in the ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan.

title: "Positive Sign": Ukraine's Zelensky Welcomes Putin's Call For Peace Talks
content: Calling it a "positive sign," Zelensky said that "the entire world has been waiting for this for a very long time. And the very first step in truly ending any war is a ceasefire."

title: 100 To 150 Missiles Every Year: Inside India's New BrahMos Production Unit
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday virtually inaugurated the BrahMos Aerospace Integration and Testing Facility in Lucknow.

title: Op Sindoor: IC-814 hijackers, Pulwama plotters among over 100 terrorists killed
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India launched 'Operation Sindoor,' eliminating over 100 terrorists in precision strikes on nine terror launchpads across the border. The operation targeted key figures and high-profile sites linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba. Indian armed forces took great care to avoid collateral damage, while Pakistan's retaliatory actions resulted in civilian casualties and damage to religious sites.

title: 'If Pak does something ... ': What PM Modi told Vance on ceasefire
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi conveyed to US Vice President JD Vance that any Pakistani aggression would face a "devastating and strong" Indian response, sources revealed. This communication occurred amidst escalating tensions following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam. Vance, present in India with his family, reportedly contacted PM Modi with concerns about a potential full-scale war.

title: Melinda French Gates opens up on Bill Gates plan to give away all his wealth
content: Melinda French Gates supports the Gates Foundation's plan to spend its $200 billion endowment by 2045 on global health, emphasizing the original intent to give back to society. The foundation will double its spending to combat diseases and poverty. French Gates believes billionaires have a moral obligation to contribute, hoping for lasting positive impact even after the foundation closes.

title: 'Op Sindoor remains active, normal relations with Pak cannot resume'
content: Despite a ceasefire declared between India and Pakistan, sources indicate "Operation Sindoor" continues in a new normal, demanding Pakistan's acceptance. Launched on May 7 in response to the Pahalgam terror attack, the operation targeted nine terror infrastructures.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'Jaish HQ in Pak's Bahawalpur hit hardest with most potent weapons'
content: Under 'Operation Sindoor', India executed precision strikes, obliterating Jaish-e-Mohammed's headquarters in Bahawalpur, Pakistan. The operation, targeting the ISI-backed terror outfit, resulted in significant casualties, including ten members of Masood Azhar's family, among them Abdul Rauf Azhar, a key figure in numerous attacks against India. This strategic move aims to dismantle JeM's leadership and send a strong message to Pakistan's ISI.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner, then open laptops to‚Ä¶
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: 'High note pe khatam kare': Kaif urges Virat Kohli to play England series
content: The cricketing fraternity is appealing to Virat Kohli to reconsider his reported Test retirement. Mohammad Kaif urged Kohli to play the upcoming England series, echoing sentiments from legends like Brian Lara and Navjot Singh Sidhu. They emphasised Kohli's importance to the team, especially with recent retirements, highlighting his invaluable experience and the nation's pride at stake.

title: Russia launches more than 100 drones at Ukraine as 72-hour ceasefire ends
content: Following a brief self-imposed ceasefire, Russia launched a significant aerial offensive against Ukraine, deploying over 100 drones. This escalation occurred after European leaders visited Kyiv to show solidarity and propose a 30-day ceasefire. While President Putin has proposed direct talks with Kyiv later this month, President Zelenskyy insists on a genuine and verifiable commitment to peace.

title: 'She's my talisman': Shreyas Iyer reveals the woman behind his success
content: On Mother's Day, Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer acknowledged his mother's unwavering support, calling her his pillar of strength. Iyer's IPL journey began with Delhi Daredevils, where he quickly rose to prominence, eventually leading Delhi Capitals to their first IPL final in 2020. Under his captaincy, Delhi Capitals reached their maiden IPL final in 2020, where they were beaten by Mumbai Indians. Iyer‚Äôs crowning achievement as a leader came last season when he led Kolkata Knight Riders to the IPL title.

title: Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to one of his biggest competitor
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: 'Ricky stepped out of the flight': IPL teams hopeful to have full squads
content: The India-Pakistan conflict has cast a shadow over the IPL, causing mixed reactions from overseas players. While some, like Punjab Kings' coach Ricky Ponting, are staying, others have left due to security concerns after a halted match. The BCCI is urging teams to reassemble for the remaining games, but some players are hesitant.

title: Kayleigh McEnany speaks out after on-air health scare during Fox News segment
content: Kayleigh McEnany, a Fox News personality, had a health scare during a live broadcast. The incident prompted concern among viewers. McEnany has since confirmed she is doing well. She thanked the Fox News team and EMTs for their quick response. She also expressed gratitude for the support she received. McEnany is resting and plans to return to television soon.

title: 'Roar of Indian forces reached all the way to Rawalpindi': Rajnath
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh asserted that 'Operation Sindoor' delivered a powerful message to Pakistan, with Indian forces' actions resonating in Rawalpindi. Launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack, the operation targeted terror sites across the border, demonstrating India's resolve against terrorism. Singh emphasized that India's response was precise, targeting military assets while avoiding civilian casualties, unlike Pakistan's provocations.

title: As IMF gives $1bn loan to Pak, Congress evokes Indira Gandhi‚Äôs 1981 triumph
content: Jairam Ramesh praised Indira Gandhi's leadership, recalling her success in securing a $5.8 billion IMF loan in 1981 despite US opposition. India later concluded the program successfully, foregoing $1.3 billion. This comes as India opposes IMF support to Pakistan, citing concerns over cross-border terrorism, while the IMF approved a $1 billion disbursement to Pakistan.

title: 'I was born to one ...': Virat Kohli pens a heartfelt Mother's Day tribute
content: Virat Kohli celebrated Mother's Day with heartfelt posts. He honoured his mother and wife Anushka Sharma. This came during a break from the Indian Premier League. Meanwhile, speculation arose about Kohli's Test retirement. Brian Lara urged him to continue playing Test cricket. Kohli's contribution to Indian cricket remains significant. His fans await his decision.

title: 'Asim Munir repeating Musharraf's mistakes': Ex envoy on tensions with Pak
content: Former High Commissioner G Parthasarthy asserts that Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, mirrored Pervez Musharraf's errors by initiating the recent conflict with India. He credited PM Modi and the armed forces for the ceasefire, while noting Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's diminished role, suggesting the army orchestrated operations without civilian approval, similar to the Kargil conflict era.

title: 'I'm sorry ... ': Preity Zinta breaks silence after blackout halts IPL match
content: Following a blackout during the Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals match in Dharamsala, attributed to the India-Pakistan conflict, co-owner Preity Zinta expressed gratitude to spectators for their calm. She thanked officials, including Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and BCCI's Jay Shah, for ensuring the safe evacuation of teams and staff. Videos showing Zinta urging spectators to leave the venue in an orderly manner quickly surfaced on social media platforms.

title: 17-year-old gangraped in moving car; friend, 19, pushed out, dies
content: In a harrowing incident on NH-334, a 19-year-old woman was killed after being pushed from a car, while her 17-year-old friend was allegedly gang-raped by three men. The survivor escaped and reported the crime, leading to the arrest of the accused after an encounter. The incident has raised concerns about highway safety and echoes a similar past crime.

title: Andhra Pradesh soldier Murali Naik's final rites held amid chants and tears
content: Agniveer Mudavath Murali Naik, 23, was martyred during 'Operation Sindoor' in Jammu and Kashmir. His last rites were performed with full state honors in Andhra Pradesh. Andhra Pradesh government announced ‚Çπ50 lakh ex-gratia, land, and a government job for Naik's family. Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan also offered personal support.

title: Germany and Israel mark anniversary in shadow of war
content: Germany and Israel commemorate 60 years of postwar relations amidst the ongoing Gaza conflict. Israeli President Herzog's visit to Berlin, marked by meetings and memorial visits, underscores the enduring yet complex bond. Chancellor Merz emphasizes Germany's commitment to Israel's security while urging adherence to international law, highlighting the challenges in navigating this intricate relationship.

title: Tendulkar celebrates Mother's Day: 'My Aai has always been my anchor'
content: On Mother's Day, cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar honored his mother, Rajni Tendulkar, acknowledging her strength and prayers as his anchor. Tendulkar, the highest run-scorer in international cricket with 34,357 runs, holds numerous records, including most Test appearances (200) and ODI career length (22 years, 91 days). His unparalleled achievements solidify his status as the 'God of Cricket'.

title: Successfully executed assigned tasks in ongoing operations: IAF after India-Pak truce
content: The Indian Air Force announced that 'Operation Sindoor' against terrorist groups in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir is ongoing, with assigned tasks successfully executed. These operations were conducted deliberately and discreetly, aligning with national objectives. This announcement follows a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan after heightened tensions, though violations were reported shortly after the declaration.

title: Tribute to our scientists and engineers: Rijiju on 26 years of Pokhran-II nuclear tests
content: India observed National Technology Day on May 11th, commemorating the 1998 Pokhran nuclear tests, which solidified the nation's status as a nuclear power. The day also recognizes the Trishul missile test and the Hansa aircraft's first flight. This annual celebration acknowledges Indian scientists' and engineers' contributions to innovation, defense, and technological self-sufficiency.

title: How Kagiso Rabada avoided doping ban to return swiftly for IPL 2025
content: South African fast bowler Kagiso Rabada faced a ban after testing positive for benzoylecgonine, a cocaine metabolite, during the SA20. His legal team successfully argued that the substance use was out-of-competition, leading to a reduced penalty. Rabada served a one-month ban, completed an educational program, and expressed remorse for his actions.

title: Congress urges PM Modi to chair all-party meet on India-Pakistan situation
content: The Congress demanded an all-party meeting and special Parliament session to discuss the India-Pakistan ceasefire, Operation Sindoor, and the Pahalgam incident. Jairam Ramesh questioned possible third-party mediation and diplomatic talks with Pakistan. Citing ex-army chiefs, he urged the PM to respond. He also recalled Indira Gandhi‚Äôs 1981 IMF negotiations, highlighting her decisive leadership during international crises.

title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill 10 people, mostly women and children
content: Overnight Israeli strikes in Gaza resulted in 10 fatalities, predominantly women and children, as reported by local health officials. The Israeli military asserts its targets are militants, attributing civilian casualties to Hamas' presence in densely populated areas. Amidst this, Israel retrieved the remains of a soldier missing since a 1982 Lebanon battle, bringing closure to a long-standing case.

title: How climate change is altering bird migration
content: Migratory birds, vital for ecosystem balance through pollination and pest control, face increasing threats from climate change. Rising sea levels endanger coastal stopover sites, while ocean acidification impacts crucial food sources. Extreme weather events and altered temperatures disrupt migration patterns, leading to habitat conflicts.

title: Virat Kohli's old interview about scoring 10,000 runs in Test cricket resurfaces
content: Reports suggest Virat Kohli may retire from Test cricket before the England series, surprising BCCI officials who wanted him to play. Despite appeals from fellow cricketers, Kohli seems determined. An old interview resurfaced where he expressed his ambition to score 10,000 Test runs.

title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting with top defence officials
content: Following a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan, Prime Minister Modi convened a meeting with top officials to discuss the situation after India accused Pakistan of violating the terms. The meeting addressed concerns arising from recent terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir, India's retaliatory operation targeting terror facilities, and subsequent drone attacks by Pakistan, which heightened fears of escalating conflict.

title: How 'mere paas maa hai' legacy lives on in Indian sports
content: On Mother's Day, we celebrate the unwavering support of mothers behind India's rising athletes. MMA fighter Ritu Phogat and chess grandmaster Koneru Humpy share their experiences balancing motherhood with demanding careers. Both athletes highlight the challenges and unexpected strengths gained through motherhood, emphasising the importance of support systems and mental fortitude in achieving professional success.

title: Ceasefire on, but pressure stays: Key decisions by India against Pak that still stand
content: India and Pakistan have agreed to a ceasefire after recent cross-border tensions. This followed the Pahalgam terror attack and subsequent Indian strikes. Despite the ceasefire, several punitive measures will stay in place. The Indus Waters Treaty remains suspended. The Attari check-post will stay closed. Trade ban and airspace restrictions will continue.

title: FIR against woman for criticising 'Operation Sindoor' in Mumbai
content: Mumbai Police have filed a case against a 40-year-old beauty parlour owner for a social media post criticising Operation Sindoor. A Bajrang Dal member noticed the post and filed a complaint, leading to the FIR under the Bhartiya Nyaya Sanhita. The woman has been served a notice and warned by the Malwani Police regarding the post.

title: 'Will work with India & Pakistan to seek solution on Kashmir': Trump
content: Donald Trump announced plans to significantly increase trade with India and Pakistan following a ceasefire agreement brokered with US assistance. The ceasefire came after heightened tensions sparked by a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, leading to military actions and retaliatory drone incursions. Trump also expressed his intention to help find a solution regarding Kashmir, acknowledging the long-standing nature of the issue.

title: Can England avoid qualifiers? 2027 ODI World Cup spot under threat
content: Doubts surround the future of ODI cricket, despite broadcast rights secured until 2031. England's captain Jos Buttler expressed uncertainty about the format's relevance. Currently ranked eighth, England faces a qualification challenge for the 2027 World Cup. Following recent poor performances, Harry Brook replaces Buttler as captain.

title: Shashi Tharoor explains why 1971 India-Pak war can't be compared to 2025
content: Following a DGMO-level conversation resulting in a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan across all fronts, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor cautioned against drawing parallels between Prime Minister Modi's actions and Indira Gandhi's leadership during the 1971 war. Tharoor emphasized the distinct circumstances, highlighting Bangladesh's moral cause and clear objective, which differed from simply exchanging fire with Pakistan.

title: Following ceasefire, wife of BSF jawan in Pak custody sees window of opportunity
content: Following the ceasefire announcement, Rajani Shaw fervently hopes for the return of her husband, BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw, held by Pakistan Rangers after mistakenly crossing the Punjab border. Talks for his release were stalled due to recent hostilities, prompting concerns about his well-being. Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee has urged immediate action to secure Purnam's release and repatriation.

title: TG EAPCET results declared: Direct link to download scorecards
content: The TG EAPCET 2025 results were released on May 11, 2025, by JNTUH, with Telangana CM Sri Anumula Revanth Reddy announcing the outcomes in a press conference. Palla Bharath Chandra from Andhra Pradesh topped the Engineering stream, while Saketh Reddy Peddakkagari from Hyderabad led the Agriculture and Pharmacy stream. With over 2 lakh candidates, the results show strong performances across the state and neighboring regions. Candidates can access their results online, and the counseling process will follow soon.

title: Long night and a sudden turnaround: 10 things that happened after India-Pakistan ceasefire deal
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire after US intervention. However, the truce was quickly violated, with explosions reported in Srinagar and drone intrusions in border regions. India retaliated, and Foreign Secretary Misri condemned Pakistan's actions. China's Wang Yi spoke with NSA Doval, emphasizing the need for regional stability.

title: Pakistan blitz meets Indian firewall
content: On Friday night and early Saturday, India successfully thwarted multiple drone and missile attacks launched from Pakistan targeting key military installations and civilian areas in Punjab's Amritsar and Gurdaspur districts. Indian air defense systems swiftly detected and neutralized the aerial threats, preventing significant damage or casualties.

title: Virat Kohli's retirement: 'You are our knight in shining armour'
content: Navjot Singh Sidhu urges Virat Kohli to reconsider his reported Test retirement ahead of the crucial five-match series against England. Sidhu emphasizes Kohli's invaluable experience, especially with Rohit Sharma's absence, highlighting the need for seasoned players in challenging conditions. He draws a parallel with Sunil Gavaskar's dedication, suggesting Kohli's presence is vital for India's success.

title: District court to pronounce sentence in  mass family killing case that shocked capital in 2017
content: The court will likely pass its verdict on Cadell Jeansen Raja, the sole accused in the ‚Äúone-by-one execution-style killings‚Äù of his father, Professor Raja Thankam, his mother, Dr Raja Thankam, a cardiologist, sister Caroll, a medical graduate from a university in China, and his congenitally blind aunt, Lalitha Gene.

title: Who let the¬†dogs out?
content: In Maharashtra‚Äôs Kadbanwadi grassland, the already endangered Indian grey wolf is now at an added risk from dogs attacking their pups or weak members of the pack. Scientists express concern about cross-breeding between the two species, which would spread infections and impact the pack dynamics.¬†Purnima Sah¬†visits the area to find that dogs are replacing wolves as apex predators

title: Lakshadweep islanders‚Äô hopes wane over connectivity to mainland; concern raised over dip in number of ships
content: 24 ships were plying for passenger and cargo transit from the mainland and also for inter-island connectivity, from 2000 to 2015. This shrunk from seven to three in 2022 and to two in 2025

title: Srirangam bus terminus likely to be ready by October
content: It is coming up on 1.08 acres of land on Gandhi Road near the Rajagopuram of Sriranganatha Swamy temple with an outlay of ‚Çπ11.10 crore to fulfil the long-felt demand of the residents

title: CWRDM‚Äôs Water Heritage Museum in Kozhikode gets global recognition
content: ‚ÄòThe museum is only the third such institution in the country to be added to the prestigious international network‚Äô

title: Railways to raze colonial era overbridge near Tiruchi Fort station on May 13
content: Southern Railway announces cancellation, diversion and regulation of a few trains in view of the proposed demolition of the overbridge; new bridge likely to be ready in 10 months

title: Tenant farmers‚Äô association urges government to take steps to prevent suicides
content: The A.P. Tenant Farmers‚Äô Association accused tobacco companies of exploiting the farmers and demanded that the government take immediate measures

title: NDA government misusing Central agencies to target Opposition, allege Congress leaders
content: Following a call given by the All India Congress Committee, the party organises a protest named ‚ÄòSamvidhan Bachao Abhiyan‚Äô, at G. Sigadam in Srikakulam district

title: Ayurveda and Homoeopathy graduates found practicing allopathy in Sangareddy
content: During the inspections officials found several individuals were not only practicing allopathic medicine without authorisation but were also administering medications typically reserved for use by licensed allopathic doctors

title: Omega Hospital denies association with narcotic buyer
content: Emphasizing that the purchase of narcotic was an isolated incident involving personal action, the Omega Hospitals clarified that the accused was not associated with our organisation in any capacity

title: Harish Rao flays Uttam Reddy for misleading people on clearances for SRLIS
content: The BRS leader accuses Congress leaders of mortgaging Telangana‚Äôs interests to Andhra from combined AP days

title: Special prayers for Nation‚Äôs well-being held in Maridimamba temple of Vizianagaram
content: Before embarking on critical missions such as protecting the country from external and internal enemies, soldiers and police personnel would visit the Dandumaramma and Maridimamba temples seeking divine blessings

title: Unqualified persons evaluated APPSC Group-I Mains answer sheets, allege police
content: Then APPSC Secretary Sitarama Anjaneyulu allegedly allowed the process to be carried out at a private place by private persons against rules

title: Nepali migrant children shine in SSLC: a story of grit, language and dreams
content: Naveen Kami secures A+ grades in all subjects, following his sister‚Äôs similar feat a year ago. The siblings speak speak fluent Malayalam ‚Äì courtesy of teachers who gave the children individual attention when they initially struggled with the language.

title: YSRCP activists in Sarvepalli constituency appear to be clueless in view of Kakani‚Äôs prolonged absence
content: Former MLA Kakani Govardhan Reddy is named as an accused in the illegal quartz mining case registered in Podalakur police station; several YSRCP activists join the TDP in the presence of Somireddy Chandramohan Reddy

title: India gifts 15 electric vehicles to Nepal for mountain dialogue
content: Nepal receives 15 electric vehicles from India for hosting Sagarmatha Sambad summit on climate change and mountains

title: Two books by Kannada writer Satyanarayana Rao Anathi launched in Shivamogga
content: Mr. Anathi brought out a collection of his poems written so far in a collection titled Mouna Migilu, and a play, Neelanjane Manimekhalai.

title: Two held on espionage charges for Pakistani official at High Commission in Delhi
content: Punjab Police arrests two suspects for leaking sensitive information to Pakistan, reinforcing commitment to national security

title: T.N. government to digitally document performing arts of Adi Dravidar, tribal communities
content: The project aims to create a digital repository titled ‚ÄòSuvadugal‚Äô to document and preserve the traditional performing arts of the tribal communities

title: Kalyana Karnataka will get 50 additional public schools, says Ajay Singh
content: According to the KKRDB chairman, the board and the State government will provide ‚Çπ100 crore each for the additional public schools

title: A.P. Minister to focus on creation of more lung space in Nellore
content: The Minister is keen on implementing the same first in his constituency, which could be replicated across the State later

title: Slain Army jawan Murali Naik‚Äôs final rites performed amidst outpouring of grief and pride
content: Slain Army jawan Murali Naik honored with military funeral, State honours, and financial support for family members

title: Rahul, Kharge demand special Parliament session to discuss Pahalgam attack, Op Sindoor

title: LDF govt. in Kerala will get a third term in power, says convener T.P. Ramakrishnan
content: The LDF is planning to resume its district-level rallies which were postponed in the wake of the Indo-Pak conflict in the border areas

content: The mock exercises have been conducted in vital installations like ports, atomic power stations, airports and thermal power stations since May 7.

title: Summer school camps enabling tribal students to improve skills
content: Organised at the suggestion of the district administration, the camps which started in May first week would continue till June second week in the selected villages

title: Might of Indian forces was felt even in Rawalpindi, says Rajnath Singh
content: It was a demonstration of India's strong will against terrorism, says Rajnath Singh while speaking about Operation Sindoorn

title: After 12 years, PMK hopes to display its hold among Vanniyar community
content: In 2013, violence erupted between Vanniyar youth and SCs in Marakkanam as they were en route to attend the Youth Conference. Senior leaders including Ramadoss and his son were arrested, which had resulted in further violence.

title: MHA grants citizenship to wife of Kolkata resident killed in Pahalgam terror attack
content: Soheni Roy wife of  Bitan Adhikari, who was killed in terror attack in Pahalgam was born in Bangladesh and had applied for citizenship after marriage to the Indian national

title: Ask Pakistanis about strength of BrahMos missile: Adityanath
content: You have seen a glimpse of the valour of the BrahMos missile during Operation Sindoor. And if the glimpse was not visible, then ask Pakistanis about the strength of the missile, says U.P. CM Yogi Adityanath

title: All-party meeting be called but parties must attend only if PM Modi participates: Sibal
content: We will not issue any criticism today because this is not the time for criticism. We only want a special Parliament session and an all-party meeting to be called, says Kapil Sibal

title: Caste enumeration in census exercise: No need to tweak law, say officials
content: Citing section 8 of the law, officials pointed out that a census officer "may ask all such questions" as "he may be directed to ask

title: Prolonging military conflict with Pakistan is not India's biggest priority today: Shashi Tharoor
content: Bangladesh was fighting a moral cause, and liberating Bangladesh was a clear objective. Just keeping on firing shells at Pakistan is not a clear objective, says Congress leader Shashi Tharoor.

title: Pakistan PM Sharif bats for 'path of peaceful negotiations' to address India-Pak issues
content: India and Pakistan on Saturday (May 10, 2025) reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea, with immediate effect

title: EAPCET 2025 results: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy releases EAPCET result
content: A total of 2,20,327 for Engineering and about 81,000 candidates had taken the computer-based test, conducted on April 29 and 30 (for Agriculture and Pharmacy streams), and May 2 to 5 (for Engineering stream).

title: Calm prevails in Punjab after understanding between India, Pakistan to stop military actions
content: "All is well here in Jalandhar. According to the information received, there is nothing to worry and work may resume as usual. Forces are on a constant vigil," Jalandhar Deputy Commissioner Himanshu Aggarwal said.

title: Detaining prisoner without trial amounts to pre-trial punishment; bail is rule, says HC
content: A Bench of Justice Milind Jadhav on May 9 also took note of overcrowded jails in the State, and said the courts need to strike a balance

title: Congress demands all-party meeting chaired by PM Modi to discuss Indo-Pak situation
content: Jairam Ramesh‚Äôs remarks came after India and Pakistan reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea, with immediate effect after four days of intense cross-border drone and missile strikes

title: Govt to hold pre-emption right over oil, gas in national emergency, say draft rules
content: Government of India shall be the sole judge as to what constitutes a national emergency in respect of mineral oils, and its decision in this respect shall be final, the draft rule said.

title: In frames | Guardians of the green
content: The Dongria Kondh tribal people of Odisha are as assertive in demonstrating their identity as they famously were in protecting the Niyamgiri Hills from mining giant Vedanta

content: According to Dr. Ayyappan‚Äôs relatives, he was a highly spiritual person and was a frequent visitor to Sri Ranganatha Swamy Temple and Nimishamba Temple in Srirangapatna.

title: Construction of second part of new integrated terminal at Chennai airport further delayed to June 2026
content: Around 25% of construction work has only been completed till now in the second part of the terminal building; excavation and building the basement with hard rock like conditions make it challenging for the contractor to expedite work

title: Operations normal; some flights may be impacted: Delhi airport
content: Enhanced security measures that were implemented in view of the tensions between India and Pakistan are still in place at airports

title: No ceasefire violation reported in Kashmir valley overnight
content: There was no ceasefire violation reported from any sector along the Line of Control in Kashmir after 11 p.m. on Saturday (May 10, 2025)

title: Counting of votes for Assam panchayat polls begins amid tight security
content: Polling took place in two phases, on May 2 and 7, in the State's 27 districts for the first time after the delimitation of the constituencies.

title: Nominations invited for best teaching practices in Telangana
content: The conclave would look at a wide range of initiatives on attendance, enrolment, classroom innovations, community participation, and overall quality improvement of schools, among others.

title: 41 A.P. students reach New Delhi from Kashmir

title: Tamil Nadu way ahead of the rest of the country in Gross Enrolment Ratio: AICTE Chairman

title: Despite ceasefire, cross-border firing from Pakistan reported across Jammu border

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Wolves take series lead in Game 3
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking a 2-0 lead over the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers . a similar pattern is playing out on the other side of the East bracket, as the third-seeded New York Knicks were blown out in Game 3 at Madison Square Garden .

title: Everything to know about Monday's draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: the 2025 NBA draft lottery brings its annual wave of intrigue Monday . the entire league descending on Chicago and offseason proceedings fully underway for most every franchise . at least 13 teams in the lottery hang heavily on which combinations are drawn . a host of intriguing young players -- many freshmen -- behind them .

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: the WNBA is the first expansion team in women's sports history to do so prior to its first season . the franchise surpasses 15,000 season-ticket deposits . a lot of eyes are on the Valkyries as teeming with a crowd of fans .

title: Draft picks who landed with the perfect team: Bowen‚Äôs favorite early-round fits
content: the 2025 draft provided plenty of strong prospect-team matches across the 257 picks . but which players are best set up for success? I wanted to highlight my 15 favorite fits, factoring in traits, schemes, playcalling tendencies and coaching staffs around the league .

title: Derek Carr retires: Who will start now? What's his legacy?
content: Jeremy Fowler joins "SportsCenter" to discuss Derek Carr's retirement . medical scans determined that Carr had sustained a labral tear and had significant degenerative changes to his rotator cuff . it's the closure New Orleans has been looking for since April 11 .

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: the battle between the national league powerhouses for the no. 1 spot continues in week 6 . los Angeles is retaking the top spot from new york, with the Tigers breaking in at the No. 5 spot . the Yankees, the Mariners and the royals are the week's biggest risers .

title: UFC 315 takeaways: Della Maddalena's first title defense may already be set
